page.title: 06STROUD GOODS SHED
page.content: Stroud Goods Shed was built by I.K. Brunel in 1856,nine years after the station.Attached to the good's shed is a Permanent Way office.There is a door from the office into the goods shed, where up some steps there is a box room to look down on the goods shed. The shed and office are now derelict but some things remain today,like the"Wait order"post cage which was used for post to Painswick (BR Road) and Dudbridge (M.R.Junction) The goods shed, office, lights and rails(together with sidings)amongst other things remain today.The roof has been taken off,the floor is covered with a green mould and some windows are bricked up or smashed;it is obviously derelict.The goods shed was closed in the 1960's by Beeching,but now there is a preservation order on it for G.W.R.150 year celebrations
